The Palm Springs Museum of Art has announced that it will return the custodial duties of its landmark Central Gallery to the artist-run nonprofit organization the Art Institute of Chicago (AIC). In a move that will greatly benefit the arts and the visual arts (and potentially benefit the city’s economy), the museum will become an “adviser” for AIC, which will operate the gallery through the end of the year, and will begin to host exhibitions.
